title: Marky Mark and the Chubby Bunch
report:
Welcome back to the Jart Report after a week sixteen that leaves us with two teams left fighting it out for the coveted league ring. Let’s get into it.

Jart’s Mailbag

Who will win the league in 2022?

If we run snake, I will take whoever has the 4th overall pick. If we do an auction, I like Aross. Feel like he would be the best sharp in such a format. But at the end of the day, the team that wins it all will be the one with the least injuries.

When will the lock out for auction begin?

Tuesday, January 3rd.

With the fantasy season coming to an end, what was your favorite moment this year?

Personal: Burrow-Chase stack clinching me a playoff spot after Penny popped

League-Wide: Sweating out roto the last three weeks of the season. I am very hesitant to make roto any more influential than it is currently in our league, but it has been a fun addition.

How are you spending New Years?

I spent most of it driving home from a conference in Minnesota, got back a little before midnight CT and then watched some TV and fell asleep on the couch. Wild times.

Why is Brad such a b*tch? Will Nath ever stop being mad?

I think Brad just likes stirring the pot. Nath will always be mad but then say he’s not.

What are your thoughts on the Louisiana purchase and its impact on climate change?

I’ve done a lot of research on this one, and the part that stood out to me the most was:

“Rich in gold, silver and other ores, as well as huge forests and endless lands for grazing and farming, the new acquisition would make America immensely wealthy. Or, as Jefferson put it in his usual understated way, ‘The fertility of the country, its climate and extent, promise in due season important aids to our treasury, an ample provision for our posterity, and a wide-spread field for the blessings of freedom.’”

Given that the US doesn’t care about climate change, all of this money and land has clearly had a negative impact on the climate. So while I was a fan of the Louisiana purchase given that we acquired it for around 4 cents per acre, the climate has paid the price.

Projected standings for next year’s regular season?

  1. Aross
  2. NN
  3. Jase!
  4. CJ
  5. Gart
  6. Bank
  7. Jart
  8. MW
  9. JL
  10. Brad
  11. Dmichs
  12. Nooni

How will Michigan lose this week?

A. Plain old loss by 10-20 pts

B. Close L, likely Harbaugh coaching error

C. Screwed by the refs

D. Domination/embarrassment by Georgia. A lot of “At least we beat Ohio State” going in the chat

D.

On To The Finals!

The Matchup:

(1) JL vs (3) CJ:

The Jart Sportsbook Official Odds: JL -3, -130

Projected Starting Lineups:

CJ:

Aaron Rodgers (ESPN 19.9, Jart 25.22)

Nick Chubb (ESPN 15.0, Jart 16.3)

David Montgomery (ESPN 16.3, Jart 14.7)

Diontae Johnson (ESPN 11.9, Jart 18.4)

Antonio Brown (ESPN 12.8, Jart 10.4)

Mark Andrews (ESPN 14.0, Jart 17.2)

Michael Pittman (ESPN 10.6, Jart 7.7)

Bills D/ST (ESPN 7.2, Jart 11.0)

Ryan Succop (ESPN 4.7, Jart 5.5)

Jart Projected Points: 126.42

JL:

Kyler Murray (ESPN 18.2, Jart 24.34)

Austin Ekeler (ESPN 16.1, Jart 13.6)

Joe Mixon (ESPN 15.9, Jart 21.4)

Ceedee Lamb (ESPN 13.4, Jart 19.4)

Deebo Samuel (ESPN 13.9, Jart 22.2)

Rob Gronkowski (ESPN 12.2, Jart 9.8)

Dare Ogunbowale (ESPN 9.3, Jart 5.6)

Pats D/ST (ESPN 7.1, Jart 13.0)

Robbie Gould (ESPN 4.4, Jart 6.0)

Jart Projected Points: 135.34

What The League Is Saying:

-I hope Cj wins. Leads to most league chaos.

-Someone will win

-I want CJ to win

-Cheering for my Former co host P.S. It was about time Rex Burkhead

-Both guys are great would be honored to have them marry my daughter

-Two best teams going at it. Just how it should be

CJ: Wow I’m really in the finals eh

JL: Excited to fight for another championship . It would be an honor to join MW in the exclusive 2* ring club. CJ’s team is real nice. Mark Andrews scares me. But my boys are nice and I plan on winning by 30+.

Family Award (A Tribute)

In recognition of a great season that ultimately came up a little short, we want to recognize CalAmari Cooper with the Family Award this week. The Dak-Amari stack stays goated.
